GameObject
Class TileMap

java.lang.Object
  GameObject.TileMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class TileMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The TileMap class is used to represent the map or grid where GamePlay takes place. It is a container for all the objects that are drawn on the grid during gamePlay, including: walls, enemies, powerUps, and the door. This class is also in charge of drawing all of these objects on the grid.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

TileMap

public TileMap(Player player,
               int selectedStage,
               java.lang.String userName)
Initialize a TileMap object to hold and interact with all the game objects that are present in a specified stage.

Parameters:
player - A player instance used to interact with various logic elements present in this class
selectedStage - An integer specifying the stage number that will be used as the blueprint for enemy generation and powerUp generation.
userName -
Method Detail

drawObjects

public void drawObjects(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draws all the game objects contained within the TileMap instance on the grid. We check if the spawn harder enemies flag is true to generate new enemies before drawing them.

Parameters:
g - Graphics object corresponding to the JPanel where the game play state is rendered.

determineIfShouldSpawnHarderEnemies

public void determineIfShouldSpawnHarderEnemies()
Function called when a bomb explosion collides with a powerUp or the door. If this is the case, we wait 20 frames for the flames to disappear and then generate the harder set of enemies.

drawTiles

public void drawTiles(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draws the wall and flame objects placed on the different tiles of the grid. Note that this information is held by the two dimension walls array, which represents the 12 by 31 map, and specifies which wall types are held by different tiles.

Parameters:
g - Graphics object corresponding to the JPanel where the game play state is rendered.

drawEnemies

public void drawEnemies(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draws the enemies on the grid.

Parameters:
g - Graphics object corresponding to the JPanel where the game play state is rendered.

nextStage

public void nextStage()
Advances to the next stage in the progression of the game. If the player has completed the last stage, it initiates the finished game logic.

populateGridWithBlocks

public void populateGridWithBlocks()
Populates the walls two dimensional array with the specific information about the walls present in the current grid. This is done by means of the Spawner class.

createEnemySet

public void createEnemySet()
Populates the enemies ArrayList with a new set of enemies that matches the blueprint given by the current stage.

addNewEnemy

public void addNewEnemy()
Adds a new enemy to the enemies ArrayList. This function is used during bonus stages, where the enemies keep spawning infinitely for 30 seconds.

generatePowerUp

public void generatePowerUp()
Generate a powerUp following the blueprint given by the current stage.

generateDoor

public void generateDoor()
Generate a door object to be placed randomly on the grid.

addFlames

public void addFlames(int bombPosX,
                      int bombPosY)
Populates the flames ArrayList with a new set of flames. This function is called when a bomb explodes.

Parameters:
bombPosX - Integer representing the x coordinate where the bomb exploded.
bombPosY - Integer representing the y coordinate where the bomb exploded.

countDownToHarderEnemySetSpawn

public void countDownToHarderEnemySetSpawn()
Countdown timer used to trigger the spawn of a harder set of enemies once the 200 seconds that a stage lasts ends.

spawnSetOfHarderEnemies

public void spawnSetOfHarderEnemies(int spawnPosX,
                                    int spawnPosY)
Creates a new set of enemies of one difficulty higher than the current most difficult enemy present on the grid.

Parameters:
spawnPosX - Integer representing the x coordinate where the new enemies will spawn.
spawnPosY - Integer representing the y coordinate where the new enemies will spawn.

moveEnemies

public void moveEnemies(int playerPosX,
                        int playerPosY,
                        boolean playerIsVisible)
Displaces the enemies on the grid, and initiates their artificial intelligence chase mode if the player is at a specified distance.

Parameters:
playerPosX - Integer specifying the x position of the player on the grid.
playerPosY - Integer specifying the y position of the player on the grid.
playerIsVisible - Boolean specifying whether the player is visible or not.

determineHarderEnemyTypeToSpawn

public EnemyType determineHarderEnemyTypeToSpawn()
Determines the hardest enemy type that follows the current hardest enemy type present on the grid.

Returns:
An EnemyType object specifying an Enemy type harder than the hardest enemy alive on the grid.

setTimeToHarderSetSpawn

public void setTimeToHarderSetSpawn(int timeToHarderSetSpawn)
Sets the boolean for timetoHarderSetSpawn

Parameters:
timeToHarderSetSpawn - Boolean is passed to set timeToHarderSetSpawn to True or False

incrementBombRadius

public void incrementBombRadius()
Increments the bomb explosion radius by 1 tile.

getCurrentStage

public StageData getCurrentStage()
Retrieve the StageData object corresponding to the current stage difficulty.

Returns:
A StageData object with the information of the current stage.

getCurrentStageNumber

public int getCurrentStageNumber()
Retrieve the current stage number the user is playing.

Returns:
An integer specfying the current stage number being played.

setCurrentStage

public void setCurrentStage(int currentStage)
Specify the stage number that the TileMap instance represents.

Parameters:
currentStage - Integer specifying the stage number that the TileMap represents.

getEnemies

public java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> getEnemies()
Retrieve the enemies present on the grid.

Returns:
An ArrayList containing the enemy objects present on the grid.

setEnemies

public void setEnemies(java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> enemies)
Set the enemies present on the grid.

Parameters:
enemies - An ArrayList containing the enemy objects to be drawn on the grid.

getWalls

public GameObject[][] getWalls()
Get the Wall objects present on the grid.

Returns:
An two dimensional array containing instances of ConcreteWall and BrickWall

setWalls

public void setWalls(GameObject[][] walls)
Specify the walls present on the grid.

Parameters:
walls - A two dimensional array representing the map. Each slot contains a wall or a null object specifying that there is no wall.

getFlames

public java.util.ArrayList<Flame> getFlames()
Get the flame objects present on the grid.

Returns:
An ArrayList containing the flame objects currently visible on the grid.

setFlames

public void setFlames(java.util.ArrayList<Flame> flames)
Set the flames objects present on the grid.

Parameters:
flames - An ArrayList containing the flame objects to be drawn on the grid.

public PowerUp getPowerUp()
Get the powerUp object contained in the grid.

The powerUp object present on the current stage.

Returns:

public void setBonusStage(boolean isBonusStage)
Set whether the TileMap instance represents a bonus stage or not.

Parameters:
isBonusStage - A boolean representing whether the TileMap current represents a bonus Stage or not.

isHarderSetAlreadyCreated

public boolean isHarderSetAlreadyCreated()
Determine whether a harder enemy set has been created or not. We can only generate a harder set of enemies once per stage.

Returns:
A boolean specifying whether a harder enemy set has been created or not.

setHarderSetAlreadyCreated

public void setHarderSetAlreadyCreated(boolean harderSetAlreadyCreated)
Set whether a harder enemy set has been created or not.

Parameters:
harderSetAlreadyCreated - A boolean specifying whether a harder enemy set has been created or not.

Returns:
A boolean specifying whether we are transitioning between stages or not.

public void setNextStageTransition(boolean nextStageTransition)
Specify whether we are transition between stages or not.

Parameters:
nextStageTransition - A boolean representing whether we are in a stage transition or not.
